required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Auto-Adjusting Positive Airway Pressure Devices
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Auto-Adjusting Positive Airway Pressure Devices

brief_summary.textblock: Little is understood about how different auto-adjusting PAP devices operate. The purpose of this evaluation is to compare two devices in a randomised two night PSG trial.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A (AirSense), 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B (Apex)
primary_outcome.description: AHI measures the number of apnoeas + hypopnoeas per hours of night (events/hour).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A, 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B.
primary_outcome.description: Number of times that Oxygen Level Drops by 3% below baseline value, Events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Number of obstructive apnoeas per hour of nights sleep, Events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Number of central apnoeas during hours of sleep, events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Number of obstructive and central apnoeas per hours of nights sleep, Events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Hypopnoeas per hour of nights sleep, Events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Number of RERAs per hour of nights sleep, Events/hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of flow-limited breaths in relation to the overall breaths at night.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A; 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B

arm_group.description: Patients will be randomised to either Group 1 or Group 2. Patients in this group (group 1) will use APAP A on the first night of the evaluation, and APAP B on the second night.
Patients will be randomised to either Group 1 or Group 2. Patients in this group (group 2) will use APAP B on the first night of the evaluation and APAP A on the second night.

intervention.description: Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events
intervention.other_name: Auto-Adjusting Positive Airway Pressure Device A

intervention.description: Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events
intervention.other_name: Auto-Adjusting Positive Airway Pressure Device B

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males aged ≥ 18 years
- Recently diagnosed with OSA (AHI ≥15). Recently defined as less than 3 months before study entry
- Naive to CPAP therapy
- Participants willing and able to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants requiring Bi-level PAP
- Participants requiring supplemental oxygen
- Participants who are pregnant
- Subjects who have a pre existing lung disease/ condition that would predispose them to pneumothorax (for example: COPD, lung cancer; fibrosis of the lungs; recent (< 2years) case of pneumonia or lung infection; lung injury)

facility.name: Center of Sleep Medicine, Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin

group.title: APAP A, Then APAP B
group.description: Patients will be randomised to either Group 1 or Group 2. Patients in this group (group 1) will use APAP A on the first night of the evaluation, and APAP B on the second night. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

group.title: APAP B, Then APAP A
group.description: Patients will be randomised to either Group 1 or Group 2. Patients in this group (group 2) will use APAP B on the first night of the evaluation and APAP A on the second night. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Patients will be randomised to either "APAP A, then APAP B" or "APAP B, then APAP A". Patients in "APAP A, then APAP B" will use APAP A on the first night of the evaluation, and APAP B on the second night. Patients in "APAP B, then APAP A" will use APAP B on the first night of the evaluation and APAP A on the second night. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Mean Apnoea-Hypopnoea-Index (AHI)
outcome.description: AHI measures the number of apnoeas + hypopnoeas per hours of night (events/hour).
outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A (AirSense), 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B (Apex)
outcome.population: 20 patients have used APAP A, for which the primary outcome was calculated. The same 20 patients have used APAP B for which the Primary outcome was calculated.

group.title: APAP A (AirSense Auto Set)
group.description: Patients in the "APAP A, then APAP B" group (group 1) will use APAP A on the first night of the evaluation, and APAP B on the second night. Afterwards the outcome will be calculated for all 20 patients having used treatment APAP A. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

group.title: APAP B (Apex iCH Auto)
group.description: Patients in the "APAP B, then APAP A" group will use APAP B on the first night of the evaluation and APAP A on the second night. Afterwards the outcome will be calculated for all 20 patients having used treatment APAP A. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

measure.title: Mean Apnoea-Hypopnoea-Index (AHI)
measure.description: AHI measures the number of apnoeas + hypopnoeas per hours of night (events/hour).
measure.population: 20 patients have used APAP A, for which the primary outcome was calculated. The same 20 patients have used APAP B for which the Primary outcome was calculated.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of AHI/ oxygen desaturation index (ODI) of Device A compared with Device B. Efficacy is defined as a residual AHI and ODI on each night of the trial. PSG scored AHI and ODI will be collected on both trial nights (excluding the ramp period); and compared using the Paired T test
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: We are testing the Hypothesis that there is a significant difference between CPAP A and CPAP B The Null Hypothesis is H0 = One CPAP is inferior to the other CPAP The Alternate Hypothesis is H1 = There is no significant difference between the CPAPs

We are testing the Hypothesis that there is a significant difference between CPAP A and CPAP B The Null Hypothesis is H0 = One CPAP is inferior to the other CPAP The Alternate Hypothesis is H1 = There is no significant difference between the CPAPs The expected difference mu is 0 events/hr The Non-Inferiority Margin delta is 0.75 events/hr (A difference of 1 event per hour is seen as clinically significant. 0.75 has been chosen to ensure any AHI change is seen).

outcome.title: Mean Oxygen Desaturation Index (ODI)
outcome.description: Number of times that Oxygen Level Drops by 3% below baseline value, Events/hour
outcome.time_frame: 1 night (446 minutes) for APAP A, 1 night (436 minutes) for APAP B.

Afterwards the outcome will be calculated for all 20 patients having used treatment APAP A. APAP A (ResMed AirSense AutoSet): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events APAP B (Apex iCH Auto): Commercially available device used to treat obstructive sleep apnea. The device automatically senses breathing and adjusts delivered pressure based on obstructive events

measure.title: Mean Oxygen Desaturation Index (ODI)
measure.description: Number of times that Oxygen Level Drops by 3% below baseline value, Events/hour

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: We are testing the Hypothesis that there is a significant difference between CPAP A and CPAP B The Null Hypothesis is H0 = One CPAP is inferior to the other CPAP The Alternate Hypothesis is H1 = There is no significant difference between the CPAPs The expected difference mu is 0 events/hr The Non-Inferiority Margin delta is 0.75 events/hr (A difference of 1 event per hour is seen as clinically significant. 0.75 has been chosen to ensure any AHI change is seen).

We are testing the Hypothesis that there is a significant difference between CPAP A and CPAP B The Null Hypothesis is H0 = One CPAP is inferior to the other CPAP The Alternate Hypothesis is H1 = There is no significant difference between the CPAPs The expected difference mu is 0 events/hr The Non-Inferiority Margin delta is 0.75 events/hr (A difference of 1 event per hour is seen as clinically significant. 0.75 has been chosen to ensure any AHI change is seen).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
